required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Variety and Portion Size on Meal Intake of Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Variety and Portion Size on Meal Intake of Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to gain a better understanding of the combined effects of meal variety and portion size on food intake at a meal. The study will also explore relationships with eating microstructure such as eating rate and bite size. Additionally, other individual characteristics will be examined for their influence on the effects of variety and portion size on meal intake.

primary_outcome.description: Weight (grams) of all meal components consumed
Energy intake (kilocalories) of all meal components consumed, calculated from weight and energy density

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in bite count
secondary_outcome.description: The number of bites of food during the meal

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in meal duration
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of the meal in minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean eating rate
secondary_outcome.description: Mean food intake per minute (grams/minute), calculated by dividing meal food intake by meal duration

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean bite size
secondary_outcome.description: Mean food intake per bite (grams/bite), calculated by dividing meal food intake by bite count

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in sip count
secondary_outcome.description: The number of sips of water during the meal

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean drinking rate
secondary_outcome.description: Mean water intake per minute (grams/minute), calculated by dividing meal water intake by meal duration

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean sip size
secondary_outcome.description: Mean water intake per sip (grams/sip), calculated by dividing meal water intake by sip count

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in switching between bites and sips
secondary_outcome.description: The number of switches between bites and sips during the meal

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of pleasantness of the taste of food samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all pleasant (0 mm) to extremely pleasant (100 mm). This will be used to calculate Sensory-Specific Satiety

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of prospective consumption of food samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from none at all (0 mm) to vary large amount (100 mm) how much of [this food] do you want to eat right now?. This will be used to calculate Sensory-Specific Satiety

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of hunger
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all hungry (0 mm) to extremely hungry (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of thirst
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all thirsty (0 mm) to extremely thirsty (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of nausea
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all nauseated (0 mm) to extremely nauseated (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of fullness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all full (0 mm) to extremely full (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of prospective consumption of the meal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the start of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from nothing at all (0 mm) to a large amount (100 mm) in answer to the question 'How much food could you eat right now?'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of the size of the meal compared to participant's usual portion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the start of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from a lot smaller (0 mm) to a lot larger (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of how filling the participant expects this amount of food to be
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the start of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from not at all filling (0 mm) to extremely filling (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of meal termination due to fullness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree (0 mm) to strongly agree (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of meal termination due to eating their usual amount
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree (0 mm) to strongly agree (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of meal termination due to eating is no longer a priority
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree (0 mm) to strongly agree (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of meal termination due to there being no food left
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree (0 mm) to strongly agree (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of meal termination due to self-consciousness about amount consumed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree (0 mm) to strongly agree (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of meal termination due to the food no longer tasting good
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree (0 mm) to strongly agree (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in estimation of proportion of meal eaten
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from 0% to 100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in estimation of calories consumed at the meal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
secondary_outcome.description: Open ended question (number of calories)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low Variety Small Portion Without Beverage
arm_group.description: Test meal with food components mixed together (low variety) with a small portion of food served without water

arm_group.arm_group_label: High Variety Small Portion Without Beverage
arm_group.description: Test meal with food components separated on the plate (high variety) with a small portion of food served without water

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low Variety Small Portion With Beverage
arm_group.description: Test meal with food components mixed together (low variety) with a small portion of food and water

arm_group.arm_group_label: High Variety Small Portion With Beverage
arm_group.description: Test meal with food components separated on the plate (high variety) with a small portion of food and water

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low Variety Large Portion With Beverage
arm_group.description: Test meal with food components mixed together (low variety) with a large portion of food and water

arm_group.arm_group_label: High Variety Large Portion With Beverage
arm_group.description: Test meal with food components separated on the plate (high variety) with a large portion of food and water

intervention.description: Meal components are mixed together on the plate
intervention.arm_group_label: Low Variety Large Portion With Beverage
Low Variety Small Portion With Beverage
Low Variety Small Portion Without Beverage

intervention.description: Meal components are served separately on the plate
intervention.arm_group_label: High Variety Large Portion With Beverage
High Variety Small Portion With Beverage
High Variety Small Portion Without Beverage
High Variety Small Portion With Beverage
High Variety Small Portion Without Beverage
Low Variety Small Portion With Beverage
Low Variety Small Portion Without Beverage
High Variety Large Portion With Beverage
Low Variety Large Portion With Beverage
High Variety Large Portion With Beverage
High Variety Small Portion With Beverage
Low Variety Large Portion With Beverage
Low Variety Small Portion With Beverage
High Variety Small Portion Without Beverage
Low Variety Small Portion Without Beverage

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be willing and able to travel to Penn State University Park campus weekly for meals
- Be fully vaccinated against COVID-19
- Be a woman 20 - 65 years old
- Regularly eat 3 meals/day
- Be willing to refrain from drinking alcohol the day before and during test days
- Have a body mass index between 18.0 and 35.0 kg/m*m
- Be willing to refrain from eating after 10 pm the evening before test sessions
- Be willing to participate in all study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Must not be a smoker
- Must not be an athlete in training
- Must not be pregnant or breastfeeding at the time of screening
- Must not have taken prescription or non-prescription drugs that may affect appetite or food intake within the last 3 months
- Must not dislike or be unable to eat the test foods (because of allergies, intolerance, or dietary restrictions)
- Must not be currently dieting to gain or lose weight
- Must not have a health condition that affects appetite
- Must not have participated in a similar study in our lab in the past year
- Must not be a student, faculty, or staff member in nutritional sciences or psychology

facility.name: Laboratory for the Study of Human Ingestive Behavior, The Pennsylvania State University

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Nutrition and Director of The Laboratory For The Study of Human Ingestive Behavior
